BYTE_PARSER_EXPLANATION: Emit data every number of bytes.
DELIMITER_PARSER_EXPLANATION: A transform stream that emits data each time a byte sequence is received. To use the delimiter parser, provide a delimiter as a string. The delimiter can be included or excluded.
NO_VALID_FORMAT_FOR_LINE_CHART: The data can not be converted to correct format.
PARSER_EXPLANATION: Parsers are used to transform the incoming raw binary data. Here they can be adjusted to the use case for creating usable messages if needed. This may include tasks such as converting the data to text, emitting useful chunks of data when they have been fully received, or even validating protocols.
PROCEED_APPSTART: The app will be restarted. Are you sure you want to proceed?
REGEX_PARSER_EXPLANATION: A transform stream that uses a regular expression to split the incoming text upon. Data is emitted as a string controllable by the encoding option.
LOCK_TOOLTIP: Prevent other processes from opening the port. Windows does not currently support this option.
READY_PARSER_EXPLANATION: A transform stream that waits for a sequence of "ready" bytes, before emitting a ready event and emitting data events.
NO_CONVERSION_POSSIBLE:
No conversion possible, because parser may 
 produce in too long streams!
FORCE_BYTE_DELIMITER_EXPLANATION: Enforces the delimitation of streams in bytes regardless of the selected parser!
OPEN_CONNECTION: Changes may only take in effect after an reconnection!
CONNECTION_OPTION_EXPLANATION: Options for the hardware-connection of the SerialPort.
